title: UserPromptSubmit Hook Contract
description: Contract for user-prompt-submit.sh hook that detects /bumper-reset command

stdin.description: Input received from Claude Code when user submits a prompt

stdout.description: Optional additional context to inject into Claude's processing

additionalContext.description: Text to add to Claude's context when /bumper-reset detected

exit_code.description: Exit code indicating success or failure

effects.content: Update baseline_tree to current working tree SHA
Confirmation message that baseline was reset and threshold budget restored

steps: 1. Read user prompt from stdin JSON
2. Check if prompt contains /bumper-reset command (exact match or with args)
- If session missing: inject error message to Claude, exit 0
- Capture current working tree as new baseline
- Compute final diff stats before reset (for reporting)
- Update session file with new baseline_tree
- Build confirmation message with old/new baseline and accepted changes
- Output JSON with additionalContext containing confirmation
5. On error: log to stderr, inject error message to Claude, exit 0 (fail open)

command_detection.must_be_command: Must be at start of line or after whitespace, not mid-word

reset_success.additionalContext:
✓ Baseline reset complete.

Previous baseline: 3a4b5c6 (captured 2025-11-02 20:15:00)
New baseline: 1f2e3d4 (captured 2025-11-02 20:45:30)

Changes accepted: 8 files, 287 insertions(+), 143 deletions(-) [430 lines total]

You now have a fresh diff budget of 300 lines. Continue coding!

reset_error_no_session.additionalContext: ⚠ Bumper Lanes: No active session found. Baseline reset skipped.

notes: This hook is critical for the consent mechanism - user explicitly approves changes
After reset, diff counter restarts from zero with new baseline
Old baseline tree persists in git objects (no data loss)
Confirmation message should be informative but concise (Claude sees it as context)
Consider future extension: /bumper-reset --dry-run to show what would be accepted
